intro: Cliffortia leptophylla var. longifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of pea-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. It is well adapted to arid conditions and can thrive in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
